snippet: Broadcasters contend Aereo’s service violates copyright laws. The company says it is not covered by the relevant provisions of those laws.
abstract: Supreme Court agrees to resolve dispute between television broadcasters and Internet start-up Aereo, which networks say threatens their businesses; broadcasters contend Aereo’s service violates copyright laws by streaming their programming; company says it is not covered by relevant provisions of those laws.

byline.original: By ADAM LIPTAK and BILL CARTER
byline.contributor: Adam Liptak reported from Washington and Bill Carter from New York.

lead_paragraph: Broadcasters contend Aereo’s service violates copyright laws. The company says it is not covered by the relevant provisions of those laws.

headline.main: Justices Take Case on Free TV Streaming
headline.print_headline: Justices Take Case On Free TV Streaming
